snippet: Airlines and baggage system engineers are crediting technological advances with the lowest number of mishandled bags since 2005.
abstract: Airlines and baggage system engineers are crediting technological advances with the lowest number of mishandled bags since 2005; SITA reports just under nine bags per thousand passengers were mishandled in 2011, down from more than 18 bags per thousand passengers in 2007.
lead_paragraph: Airlines and baggage system engineers are crediting technological advances with the lowest number of mishandled bags since 2005.

headline.seo: Good Airline News: They’re Losing Fewer Bags
headline.main: Good Airline News: Losing Fewer Bags
headline.print_headline: Good Airline News: Losing Fewer Bags
